metadata.title: CVE-2022-23125 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - high
metadata.description: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code onaffected installations of Netatalk. Authentication is not required toexploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within thecopyapplfile function. When parsing the len element, the process does notproperly validate the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to afixed-length stack-based buffer. An attacker can leverage thisvulnerability to execute code in the context of root. Was ZDI-CAN-15869.This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code onaffected installations of Netatalk. Authentication is not required toexploit this vulnerability.The specific flaw exists within the copyapplfile function. When parsingthe len element, the process does not properly validate the length ofuser-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-basedbuffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in thecontext of root.]

criterions.comment: netatalk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
